emeraldCasino.games.cards

Class Poker

  • java.lang.Object
    • emeraldCasino.api.games.AGame
      • emeraldCasino.api.games.card.ACardGame
        • emeraldCasino.games.cards.Poker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICardGame, IGame

    public class Poker
extends ACardGame
    Basic Poker Implementation, allowing for games of basic 5 card draw.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Minothor

      • DealCards

        public void DealCards()

      • checkMultis

        protected void checkMultis(java.util.List<Card> toEval)
        Clears the oK# lists and fills them with the values derived from the cards list. Constructs a HashMap with Card Values as Keys and increments the associated Value to count.
        Parameters:
        toEval - The List of cards to parse.

      • checkStraight

        protected boolean checkStraight(java.util.List<Card> cards)
        Checks if the cards form a consecutive sequence. Iterates along the List comparing the card values.
        Parameters:
        cards - The list of cards to be evaluated
        Returns:
        true If it reaches the end of the list and the difference is 1 for a standard Straight or 9 for a Royal Flush

      • checkFlush

        protected boolean checkFlush(java.util.List<Card> cards)
        Checks if the cards are all from the same house. Parses the list of cards comparing the house value.
        Parameters:
        cards - The List of cards to Evaluate.
        Returns:
        true, If successful the difference between tested cards remains 0

      • checkRoyal

        protected boolean checkRoyal(java.util.List<Card> toEval)
        Checks if the card hand is a royal flush. Only called if both Straight() and Flush() are true.
        Parameters:
        toEval - A List of cards to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        true if the Max card value is 13 and the Min card value is 1

      • EvalHand

        public int[] EvalHand(java.util.List<Card> cards)
        EvalHand(List) Evaluates the Hand passed.
        Overrides:
        EvalHand in class ACardGame
        Parameters:
        cards - An array of cards to be evaluated according to the basic rules of Poker.
        Returns:
        priority[] Returns an array of integers.
        • First value is the Hand value, ranging from HighCard:1 to RoyalFlush:10
        • Second value is the card value of 4 of a Kind, ranging from 2 to 14 (high ace)
        • Third value is the card value of 3 of a Kind, ranging from 2 to 14 (high ace)
        • Fourth value is the Highest pair value, ranging from 2 to 14 (high ace)
        • Fifth value is the highest card value in the deck, ranging from 2 to 14 (high ace)

      • getMax

        protected int getMax(java.util.List<Card> toEval)
        Parses a list of Card values and returns the maximum value. Treats 1 (ace) as highest value
        Parameters:
        toEval - the list of cards
        Returns:
        the maximum value of the cards parsed.

      • getMax

        protected int getMax(int[] toEval)
        Gets the max value of the integers passed to it. Treats 1 (ace) as highest value
        Parameters:
        toEval - the array of integers.
        Returns:
        the maximum value of parsed integers.
